history.content:
I can believe that there are people who have successfully done so. I would also expect that more people haven't. This is entirely up to the professors.

If you think that this would be a substantial problem, you should talk to professors now, probably before you enroll in the courses.

------------------------------

^ I think OP is talking about the current semester.

Your best bet would be to email all three professors explaining your situation and hope for the best. Out of those three classes, I think CS61C would be the class most likely to provide an alternate final for you (just my opinion).

-------------------------------

Regarding 61C, I should point out that Professor Katz has mentioned the alternate final will likely be at another time on Thursday (probably 3-6 pm), rather than having it on another day. It's post ID 11 on the 61C Piazza.

I can believe that there are people who have successfully done so. I would also expect that more people haven't. This is entirely up to the professors.

If you think that this would be a substantial problem, you should talk to professors now, probably before you enroll in the courses.

------------------------------

^ I think OP is talking about the current semester.

Your best bet would be to email all three professors explaining your situation and hope for the best. Out of those three classes, I think CS61C would be the class most likely to provide an alternate final for you (just my opinion).

I can believe that there are people who have successfully done so. I would also expect that more people haven't. This is entirely up to the professors.

If you think that this would be a substantial problem, you should talk to professors now, probably before you enroll in the courses.

children.subject:
IEOR 135 does not have a final, only final project.

CS 188 professor has remarked that there would be no makeup final.

Its unlikely that a makeup final would be provided on an alternate day since Friday is the final day of the exam schedule.

But I guess you can do two back to back maybe? :)

3 back to back finals... Looking for advice

With my current schedule for next semester (CS188, CS164, IEOR 135, CS C100), I'll have back to back to back Friday finals for CS188, CS164, and IEOR 135. I need 3 CS upperdivs and 3 units of a technical elective to graduate next semester. Has anyone been in this position and successfully had one (or two) of the finals moved to an earlier time? I really don't think I'll do well on my 2nd and 3rd finals that day, and I don't know what else to do.

history.content:
I currently have 3 finals (61c, math 110, and ds 100) all scheduled on Thursday. Has anyone successfully gotten a final moved to a different day on the premise of having 3 in one day being too much? I've heard some rumors but haven't found anything concrete on Google

(apart from a Berkeley guide saying less than 4% of students have this problem, and that students should avoid this by not taking those classes together)
history.subject: 3 finals (all techs) in one day policy?
